cards.kikuyu: This looks like a great way to start learning **Kikuyu**! Combining the words you have here is a perfect exercise. Here are ten simple sentences formed by combining the verbs and nouns from your image: ## Simple Kikuyu Sentences ðŸ‡°ðŸ‡ª 1. **Å¨ka haha.** $\rightarrow$ Come here. 2. **AndÄ©ka marÅ©a.** $\rightarrow$ Write a letter. 3. **RÄ©ra maÄ©.** $\rightarrow$ Cry for water. (This could also mean "Cry water," depending on context, but "cry for water" is a common simple expression). 4. **Theka mÅ©thÅ©uri.** $\rightarrow$ Laugh at the man. 5. **RÄ©a irio.** $\rightarrow$ Eat food. 6. **Aria na mwanake.** $\rightarrow$ Speak with the young man. 7. **Thii wÄ©ra.** $\rightarrow$ Go to work. 8. **Thooma marÅ©a.** $\rightarrow$ Read a letter. 9. **Ruga Å©cÅ©rÅ©.** $\rightarrow$ Cook porridge. 10. **MÅ©irÄ©tu aruta wÄ©ra.** $\rightarrow$ The girl is doing work. (Literally: Girl remove/do work). --- ### A Few Bonus Sentences! âœ¨ Here are a few more using the remaining words for extra practice: * **Kira, mÅ©tumia.** $\rightarrow$ Keep quiet, woman. * **Ruta irio.** $\rightarrow$ Remove the food. * **MÅ©thÅ©uri arÄ©a irio.** $\rightarrow$ The man is eating food. Let me know if you'd like to try translating any of those sentences back into English or if you have another list of words you'd like to work

cards.kikuyu: Here is the transcription and translation of the Kikuyu story titled "KarÅ©gano ka WambÅ©i MÄ©core na Njogu" (Story of Zebra and Elephant), presented in plain text: *** ## Transcription and Translation: Story of Zebra and Elephant **KarÅ©gano ka WambÅ©i MÄ©core na Njogu** - **Translation** **Story of Zebra and Elephant** * **WambÅ©i MÄ©core** - **Zebra** * **yarÄ© Ä©mwe ya nyamÅ©** - **was one of the animals** * **irÄ©a ciarÄ© thaka mÅ©no** - **that were most beautiful** * **bÅ©rÅ©riinÄ© wa nyamÅ©** - **in the country of animals** * **YarÄ© na rÅ©Å©a rÅ©thaka** - **it had a beautiful hide (skin)** * **rwa mÄ©karara mÄ©erÅ© na mÄ©irÅ©** - **with black and white stripes** * **NyamÅ© ciothe** - **all the animals** * **ciamÄ©roragÄ©ra Ä©gegete mÅ©no** - **looked at (Zebra) in awe** * **NyamÅ© cionaga** - **the animals saw** * **Ä©rÄ© ya mathekania mÅ©no** - **as very funny** * **YatÅ©maga matheke** - **it made them laugh** * **kinya makoma mbaru** - **until their ribs ached (hardened)** * **MamÄ©Å©ragia atÄ©rÄ©rÄ©** - **They used to ask it...** * **MÄ©core, Å©hÅ©raga thÅ© cÄ©aku atÄ©a?** - **Striped one, how do you fight your enemies?** * **MÄ©core yarÅ©gamaga** - **The striped one would stand** * **na magÅ©rÅ© ma mbere** - **with the forelegs** * **Ä©gaikÄ©ia mateke** - **and kicked** * **na magÅ©rÅ© ma thutha** - **with the rear legs** * **NyamÅ© ciothe** - **all the animals** * **cÄ©agÅ©agÄ©a na mÅ©theko** - **fell down laughing (broke into laughter)** * **HÄ©tÄ© nÄ©yo yathekaga** - **hyena is the one that laughed** * **na mÅ©gambo mÅ©nene** - **in a loud voice** * **gÅ©kÄ©ra nyamÅ© irÄ©a ingÄ©** - **than all the other animals** * **O na Å©mÅ©thÄ©** - **even today** * **hÄ©tÄ© yarÄ©rikana** - **when hyena remembers** * **Å©rÄ©a WambÅ©i MÄ©core** - **how the zebra** * **Ä©rÅ©aga** - **fights** * **Ä©thekaga Ä©rÄ© Ä©kÄ© Å©tuko** - **it laughs alone in the night** (A faded watermark vertically on the right side
